ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: N/a
much heavier towards the end of the course - average for the majority was about 4 hours for reading etc.

There is not very much work needed during the week, but the bulk comes with the systematic review at the end of the course. There are a few assignments related to preparation of the systematic review but besides that reading for each class is the only thing needed per week.
3 hours
I spent a greater than average amount of time for this class that most of my others during this semester. Due to recall bias I won't give a quantifiable number.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: N/a
the format of the class was a little dry, could have involved more discussion, could be more student lead (maybe more homework or mini projects)I liked that we learned to do a systematic review
General overview of obesity. It was an okay course.
Great class. Learned a lot, and now have a paper I plan on publishing!
Good broad view of the problem of obesity. Excellent opportunity to complete a potential publication.
Very interesting course material, not a great deal of outside work for the course. Starting the systematic review early is a good idea.

I enjoyed how the lectures covered an array of topics, and additionally incorporated speakers from outside YSPH. It was also helpful to work on the systematic review incrementally throughout the semester to gain feedback on the topic and process.

Great class. Taught me how to do a systematic review. All of the work came at the end of the semester. Perhaps having us do the intro, methods, results, etc. as assignments can make it less bottom heacy. Also more class discussion would be great.
The course provided students with a strong background into causes of and prevention interventions relating to obesity. Dr. Irwin's expertise and the guest lectures made for a very interesting course.

Excellent overview of obesity and the current evidence on interventions. I wish there was a final lecture summarizing the main points of the course and key papers in the area.The assignment was an excellent way to create a comprehensive piece of work on the subject and contribute to the literature under the instructor's guidance.

Really enjoyed this course. Coming in, I believed that this class was to be more biological, but I really appreciated learning about the how integral behavioral components are for weight loss. I really enjoyed the semester project, and after several revisions look forward to submitting my review for publication.
Excellant

I really enjoyed this class. It covered great topics involving the biological, social, and behavioral factors related to obesity. I also liked completing the systematic review throughout the course and the class presentations.
This class was very informative, but I would enjoy more of a discussion as opposed to a lecture.

I loved this course. It really expanded my interest on issues surrounding obesity. Lectures covered different aspects of the epidemic but were planned in a way that made sense. The graded components of the class were not necessarily related o lectures but Melinda was so helpful in providing individual feedback that I still felt prepared and supported.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  N/a

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  strengths: very knowledgable, very accessible, helpful with comments and feedback on assignmentsweaknesses: tended to really just stick to what was on the powerpoint even though I know she knows much more
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  She was okay.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Clearly knows her information and loves what she does. Great instructor.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Enthusiastic, knowledgeable, very efficient in providing feedback and very comprehensive feedback on the assessments.

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Excellent! More instruction on how to do a systematic review, especially the search for articles, would have been helpful. Maybe 1 lecture dedicated on how to carry out/write a systematic review.

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Dr. Irwin is very accessible and willing to meet with students. She is extremely friendly and helpful. Perhaps most importantly, she is incredibly enthusiastic about the material, and eager to share her knowledge.

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Dr. Irwin was a wonderful professor! She provided engaging and diverse lectures each week, and found ways to incorporate class discussion into mostlectures. She provided comprehensive feedback on all assignments in a very timely manner. She also responded to emails and questions about the course with a rapid turnaround.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Great Professor. Extremely knowledgeable on the topic. I learned a lot from her presentations.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Dr. Irwin was fantastic: extremely knowledgable, able to communicate her expertise well, and extremely supportive of students.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Prof. Irwin was a great instructor. She did a great job walking her students through the material and mentoring them through the class' final project.

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Dr. Irwin was a great teacher and I enjoyed coming to her class. Everyday I learned several new things. I enjoyed the guest lecturers she included in her course and the fact that she chimed in every now and then instead of kicking back and letting the guest lecturers do all the work.Dr. Irwin has another excellent quality that I think is rare among teachers. For whatever reasons I never feared receiving herfeedback and even enjoyed receiving her guidance for our projects. Her insights were more collaborative in nature and this made my review much better from it.Thank you for a great semester.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Very cooperative, excellent teCher
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Dr. Irwin is a great lecturer. She is very approachable and always offered helpful feedback on our project assignments.
Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  The instructor was passionate about the topic, but did not involve the class in discussion.

Instructor: Melinda Liggett Irwin  Melinda is amazing! She is not only a great lecturer but extremely supportive of her students. She gave us the freedom to research what we wanted, made time to meet with us one on one, and even encourage us to publish.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: N/a
definitely would recommend- gives a lot of information on multiple aspects of obesity, important skill learning for how to write a systematic review
This course provided an overview of obesity. I really enjoyed the guest lecturers.
A lot of work towards the end of the semester, but worth it!
Yes- very much enjoyed the assessment and opportunity to write a systematic review.
Recommend it to anyone interested in obesity, nutrition, physical activity.

The course covered an array of issues related to obesity, and also included a couple interesting speakers from outside YSPH. All assignments for the course contributed to the final paper - a systematic review on an obesity intervention. Dr. Irwin provided ample feedback throughout the semester to take sure that students completed the assignment correctly. I recommend this course if you are interesting in learning more about obesity as a domestic public health issue.
Great course if you would like to learn how to do a systematic review. Not too much work until the end of the semester when the review is due.
Great overview course of energy imbalance consequences and obesity intervention/policy effectiveness.
This class is an overview of the current issues regarding obesity and the latest literature about interventions.
I really enjoyed this course and recommend it to anyone with any interest in studying obesity.
I would recommend this class to someone interested in obesity interventions.

This was my favorite course! It covers many interesting aspects of obesity and has great guest lecturers. The systematic review can be intimidating but its a great thing to learn and Melinda is very helpful and available.
